Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can't bind this context to imported routes array" (#1770) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.7.0

### Reproduction link
[https://pastebin.com/nWxRA8kD](https://pastebin.com/nWxRA8kD)

### Steps to reproduce
See PasteBin for sample code.

I've tried defining routes as a function too to bind context, but when I do this it tries to call forEach on it and it's of course not working..

### What is expected?
Have a way to bind so "this" is accessible from the imported array.

### What is actually happening?
I don't see a way how to do that..

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "I need a method to fresh the current route" (#1772) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody: In a android App project. , I jump to a native page to login in the user center page. after login,Android need to fresh my webPage to view user's infomation with a callback，but i can only use  `location.reload()` to fresh the hole page.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "v-show/v-if seems not working after route changed " (#1771) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello, I encounter this weird issue during using vue-router. After I transition to different route(component) and then get back to the same component, the v-show/v-if is not working and all the DOM element will has the style 'display: none' on it no matter how I change the data like 'isDesignContentShow' below. ```
``` Any help is really appreciated : )

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "forEach performance issue" (#971) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
I am running into some performance issues and I am wondering if I am not using the framework properly or something can be done about this in the source code.

In my callstack it looks like the `forEach` calls are taking up a lot of time:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2384912/30963390-89a02f3a-a44d-11e7-9dcb-e1b6eb89e836.png)

From what I have read `forEach` offers readability but is quite slower in most cases. Yet I see that the Vuex code has an abundance of `forEach` calls in it. Why is this being used instead of loops with offer quite some performance gains?

Am I missing something here?

The `forEach` call from my stack comes from this line of code:

https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/blob/c87b72f2ff7f65e708c4b59a752ef234d0f28d1f/src/store.js#L102

I am hoping someone can shed some light on this. Also I didn't use the official issue application because  I couldn't properly answer half of the questions for this issue.
